author: eb1101
content: huh, was there just a big block time gap, between 13245272 and 13245273

author: alexssd7fp
content: That’s fine, it happens sometimes. According to calculations every 25k blocks

author: eb1101
content: that doesn't sound right to me at all, I don't remember ever seeing a gap that long in months

author: eb1101
content: there was just another large one btw, between 13246056 and 13246057, seems a bit strange for a coincidence that today hit this statistical unlikely hood twice in pretty near succession, but not suggesting I know any other reason it's happened

author: eb1101
content: this was a 2m22s gap again now

author: ajsutton
content: Could easily be a mining pool having temporary outages that significantly drops hash rate and then it recovers. But randomness does mean all distributions of events eventually happen.
